column4: When I setup my encrypted home, it gave a rather complex passphrase, which I've lost. Can I reset this?
you cannot
thats the point of encryption
as far as i know, the data cannot be recovered
I'm logged in currently, I'd need to backup ~/, format, then setup a new ~/ from scratch?
is your home encrypted or entire /
just ~/
all iam saying is, there is no easy way to recover ~/ or home as i call it
even if i steal the hard disk , i dont think its possible thats what i  read
I've not lost my ~/, I'll tar it and make a new one, I guess
you said you forgot passphrase
then how will you acess it?
yes, I couldn't access it from a LiveCD, I'm currently logged in from my install
Yea, I agree.
Since I'm currently logged in on my install, can I change my passphrase?
hmm that probably might be ,its somewhere in a file in hidden home
wait there is a way i think
http://blog.dustinkirkland.com/2009/03/mounting-your-encrypted-home-from.html
the password is stored in some folder
I have two lines in that file, which is the correct one?
sorry iam a noob at this , cant advice
no one
